headline: Synopsys Moves Closer to $35 Billion Ansys Acquisition With CMA Approval
summary: The CMA's decision prevents the transaction from advancing to Phase 2 scrutiny, allowing continued collaboration.

raw.headline: Synopsys Moves Closer to $35 Billion Ansys Acquisition With CMA Approval

headline: Synopsys Responds to the UK Competition and Markets Authority Provisionally Accepting its Proposed Remedies in Phase 1 Regarding its Proposed Acquisition of Ansys
summary: Today, Synopsys issued the following statement in response to the UK Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) provisionally accepting its proposed remedies in Phase 1 regarding its proposed acquisition of Ansys:

headline: U.K. Competition Watchdog Considers Conditional Approval for $35 Billion Synopsys, Ansys Deal
summary: The U.K. competition regulator said it could approve Synopsys’s $35 billion purchase of Ansys after the companies offered to sell off business units to ease regulators’ concerns.

raw.headline: U.K. Competition Watchdog Considers Conditional Approval for $35 Billion Synopsys, Ansys Deal
raw.summary: The U.K. competition regulator said it could approve Synopsys’s $35 billion purchase of Ansys after the companies offered to sell off business units to ease regulators’ concerns.

headline: UK watchdog says it may accept remedies in $35 billion Synopsys-Ansys deal
summary: Synopsys announced its cash-and-stock deal for Ansys, whose software is used to make products ranging from airplanes to tennis rackets, in January last year.  The Competition and Markets Authority said the undertakings offered on Dec. 31 included the divestment of Ansys' power consumption analysis product for digital chips and Synopsys' sale of its global optics and photonics software business.
